channel.title: Are these headphones any good? (Skullcandy)
channel.description:
http://www.skullcandy.com/shop/skullcrushers-black-pinstripe
Skullcandy skullcrushers These headphones are $70 originally but I found some on ebay for $28. Are skullcandy headphones good, bad? They seem really nice for the price. I'm just looking to listen to music with headphones that have the heavy-bass ability.
Ebay ($28, from skullcandy): http://www.ebay.com/itm/230874668231

item.title: Are these headphones any good? (Skullcandy)
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

I only buy Bose. I’ve owned the same pair of Bose headphones for the last year, no decrease in sound quality, doesn’t rape my ear with bass and rather has a great sound quality over all with both bass and treble, lasted the longest out of any headphones I’ve bought (including Skullcandies 80$ metal something they broke after a month, I think Beats are just a fad so I’ve never owned a pair).

item.title: Are these headphones any good? (Skullcandy)
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Skullcandy are good, I’m on my second pair of them.
They are reasonably priced and give a good (not amazing but good) sound quality. They have the stylish look are well known for their headphones.

I use the ink’d ones though, one of the cheapest skullcandy headphones, only £20 RRP ($32) and good sound quality and my first pair only broke because I snapped it in half and that was about a year of usage (not intentional ofc). You get two sets of earbuds, one small and one large (small ones sit more comfortably for me). You can get in a variety of colours for the headphones aswell as have better models i.e. the titans which are still only around the £40 bracket.
Good quality at a cheaper price, the sound isn’t crazy loud compared to other headphones though. It is still loud but some people like to have their ears ringing for days.

Read full topic

item.title: Are these headphones any good? (Skullcandy)
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

right off the bat I want to say that there’s nothing wrong with skullcandy and beats headphones necessarily, but skullcandy and beats headphones have been proven time after time to be rebranded headphones with an added markup in the 200-300% range, the reason skullcandy and beats may sound good is because generally they’re only compared to other bad quality products around the same price point

e.g., the pair you linked to is £49.99 on the UK website, such a price would buy you an entry level pair of hi-fi headphones which I guarantee would blow the skullcandys out of the water in terms of overall sound quality, and £150-200 is still considered to be the cheap end of proper hi-fi headphones

Read full topic
